38805723.review:
It's basically Human Interraction Simulator: Anime Style.
By playing 1bitHeart, users will learn how to effectively interrogate, communicate, and befriend other people.
Players must understand how to fluently bring up particular topics within conversations without breaking the flow.
It is most reccomended that the player is a NEET, as the game is better suited for the NEET-kind.
10/10, harder than Dark Souls.

38708571.review: Miwashiba once again delivers a sweet, succinct and satisfying story. 1bitHeart is, between the 3 games available on steam, the most gameplay heavy one. An interesting puzzle game style which fits well with the tone and story of the game. If you're considering this game you've probably already played some of Miwashiba's games, but if not, the usually hallmarks are there. Touching story, neat character design and charming if slightly stilted dialog. It's admittedly a short game, but it's therefor longer than it needs to be, and thus, can be quickly pick up and enjoyed. Miwashiba proves once again to be one of the masters of cozy, feel good games.

38252677.review:
Are you a social outcast who has no friends?  Do you wish to indulge in the fantasy of interacting with [b]LIVE HUMAN BEINGS[/b] but through the safety of a virtual medium? Then look no further, this game is for you poor, poor, lonely soul. [strike]oh wait thats me[/strike]

Now I realize this sounds like every [strike]animu porno plot[/strike] [B]INTERACTIVE JAPANESE NOVEL[/B] on Steam ever but trust me on this one, this ain't nothin' like that. Why [i]yes[/i] you are going around, hunting down people like their Pokemon tossing all sorts of sh*t to befriend them, but the game takes a fairly "realistic" approach to this. Sure, while you do end up actually befriending some people, (whatever that is.) such is not always the case. Some characters begrudgingly add you to your friend list just to stop you from bothering them anymore. Not to mention they still act like total assh*les to you even after befriending them. Considering how many supposedly "anti-social" VN protagonists are actually charismatic gods, this MC is a weird fellow and acts like the part. So yeah, if you're concerned that this is yet another game where everyone worships the MC at the end, fear not, there will be people who are either merely putting up with him or outright dislike him even though they're supposedly "friends."  

While the subplots are good, the process of unlocking them can be a tad tedious. Not too much to be a major flaw  but still annoying. For one, you need to buy items that specific character likes (Though if you're lazy you can totally brute force it by just using the cheapest item on everyone.) which costs bits. These can only be earned by [strike]streaming[/strike] playing either Puyo Puyo or Tetris. While these minigames are fun (No sh*t it's f*cking Tetris/Puyo Puyo.) it does disrupt the flow of narrative quite drastically. Running out of bits means the player has to stop whatever they were doing and spend time playing minigames they might not actually enjoy. Or perhaps enjoy but dislike due to the fact they are forced to play it to make any further progress. Now of course, the devs were wise enough to consider this and gives the player an option to get 999999 bits right from the start. Unfortunately, this option is hidden away (in the bottom right corner of the room where you buy stuff.) without any hints to it's existence...at least none I'm aware of. This could be chalked up to me just being dumb and not noticing it and if so, then I'll drop this point completely. Another quality of life issue would be being able to buy items directly from the inventory screen instead of having to backtrack constantly. 

But all the above is mere nitpicking, the game overall is an excellent experience well worth your time. Interesting character designs, endearing characters, a nice soundtrack (Ah one last nitpick: I would recommend not having a vocal track during sequences that require deep thought e.g: the discussion/talking segment. While nice, the lyrics end up being a distraction to the player. Though perhaps it's just me...) and an intriguing story all make up for a great game.

I highly recommend this game! 

tl;dr IZ GUD.

我承认一开始是看到立绘画风很合胃口才买的，但随着剧情推进，渐渐发现774那种刚出生的小猫一般的性格真的很吸引人……可能也是和自己有点相似的原因吧，总之人设真的非常棒！

最后，稍微吐槽一下，社恐加抑郁患者表示交朋友真的好难😲
最后的最后，趁其不备赶紧抱走774～请收下我的15颗心⊙ω⊙

37232659.review:
Ah, 1bitheart, my favourite of the three miwashiba games.

Anyway, short in short, this is, in my opinion, a well made and visually appealing game. The low price tag certainly nets you more than you can buy, and then some.

First off, the story: Nanase Yoshi, a fourteen-year-old boy who goes by the moniker "Nanashi", is a reclusive, yet outwardly cheerful shut-in during a time period where technology has advanced rapidly. One day, he discovers a girl fast asleep in his bed who, when woken up, proclaims she has lost her memories.

Sound familiar?

Despite the use of cliches, the game doesn't feel stale. The story itself is, admittedly, not the most complex or thought-provoking story of all time, and there are certainly better ones out there, but it doesn't make any glaring flaws that turn someone off from playing the game entirely, unless you're a temporal scientist, theorist or fanatic. The characters, both main and side, are all certainly quirky and enjoyable to watch as your cast stumbles through a rather slipshod plot, and there are some genuinely funny moments that you'll grin at, as well as some surprisingly philosophical rhetoric that you wouldn't expect.

However, know that, in my opinion, the story and plot is perhaps the weakest portion of this game, and not something you should be expecting a whole lot out of. (Though that's not to discount the entire writing at all; there are certainly some better parts than others and it's still worth reading.)

Next, the gameplay; the game plays out like Danganronpa; using information you've received from the story to find holes in someone else's story and progress forwards afterwards. As a big danganronpa fan myself, this was a very welcomed way to progress, and it, for the most part, was smooth and intuitive, though admittedly sometimes it wasn't very mentally stimulating due to either A: being too easy to deduce, or B: being too *hard* to deduce. There were definitely a few kinks in the system (particularly the discrepancy between "present a topic" and "hold a sec!"), but those are fairly easy to pick around and ignore afterwards.

Now, that isn't the only part of the game. The second portion of the game is Making Friends. Surprisingly uncommon and inane, but nevertheless decently executed. The friend system works like Danganronpa as well: give a character a gift and, if enough gifts are received, a scenario will play out between Nanashi and whichever Side Character you've chosen to befriend. Eventually, at the end of a short side-story, Nanashi befriends the character and goes on his merry way.

Admittedly, this portion of the game could've been done better and had more effort put into it. The characters, while quirky and all (okay, maybe mostly depending on how you enjoy characters) lovable and appealing, lack a major impact on the plot, and, if it weren't for some factors affected by your friend count, could very well be erased from the game entirely. The sidequest storylines were rather unfulfilling, and it certainly made me wish that these side characters received more screen time, writing and character depth (though with an impressive number of side characters, that may be a feat in and of itself). However, the characters are still, for the most part, fun to interact with (for the limited amount of conversation they have with Nanashi)

(and a bonus nitpick from me: You buy the gifts on Nanashi's computer in his bedroom, and you get "bits" (the currency) from playing the games on the console in the middle. I either missed this explanation or the game lacked it entirely, and I didn't learn of this until the final chapter)

Finally, the visual presentation of this game. One of the best parts of the game without a doubt, and where miwashiba shines. The artwork is, simply put, stunning to look at. The colour palettes are extremely easy and enticing to the eyes, the sprite work is very well made, and the character designs are all extremely appealing, all of which are very typical of miwashiba. Admittedly, some of the backgrounds can be a bit simple, but the minimalistic feel doesn't necessarily detract from the overall presentation, and it feels complete. On a plus, the voice lines (while in japanese) are pleasant to hear, though admittedly you won't hear much of it.

Oh, and did I ever mention the music? The music in this game is amazing.

All in all, 1bitheart is definitely a game that's worth picking up for the amount of money that it costs (especially when it goes on sale), and I wholeheartedly recommend it.

++PROS++
Stellar visual presentation
Smooth, simple and intuitive gameplay
Amazing music.
Likable characters.
More content than expected for the price tag

--CONS--
Slipshod storyline
Lack of side-character interaction/depth
Slightly unintuitive game choices

37131677.review:
It's a super cute game with an interesting story. It resembles Ace Attorney in a way with the talking and discussion time. (I prefer Ace Attorney's court sessions more though just because I can keep going back to the court records and see my evidence anytime I want to). With 1BitHeart, you only get to see your evidence before the discussion and talking time and when you present an evidence. It does not matter much becuase the discussion and talking time are not that long that you'll suffer over it. You'll also get HP and keep gaining more HP and the HP refreshes after every talking/discussion time. You start off with 15 and that is more than enough and allows room for mistakes. 
In addition to that, the soundtrack is nice and goes along with the actions. 
Overall, it's a very cute game and everyone should just get it.

36685661.review:
In all of my life, I never expected to get emotionally attached to every single character in this game, When I first got it, I believed it to be a sweet make friends simulator. But in reality it was much, much more.

This game grips you tight and basically consumes your life until you beat it for the first time, and still there is so much content just waiting out there in the game if you do not attempt to get all the achievements first go.

It hurt my heart going for the Normal End and Bad End, but I am glad I got to experience them in their entirety, now if only I could find where glue is so I can glue the shattered peices of my heart back together lol.

Though I loved all the characters, one caught my eye the most. Sora. Sora's story was so sad, and made me want to be his friend more, after all, who could say no to that sweet boy. Sure he becomes a big ole tsundere dork when you try to be friends, but he means well and seems to be just self-defensive. After you become friends he seems to have opened up more, and gets really defensive if you give him a Love Chocolate. 

Nio, Sora, and Nanashi (Both Forms) are my top favorites, These children are ones I can relate to deeply, I act happy and polite to people, like how Nio does. I get defensive and think somethings a joke when someone shows me a form of affection that I am not used to, like Sora. And I'm willing to change myself to help others, even if its in a situation I've never been in before, like Nanashi (I can proudly say I've never choked out my future self, though if I did, that would be pretty Epic.)

In the end, I highly reccomend this game, and hope whomever buys it, is ready to be absorbed by it and sending mass amounts of pictures to your friends of all the characters you love.

36556376.review:
The first game from Miwashiba that I've played, and I have to say that I was extremely impressed.  I'm not much of a completionist, but found all the characters so sweet (and the main characters so much fun to get to know) that I made a point of playing through and befriending everyone possible.

Pros:
+Excellent and engaging story, with characters who are interesting and original.  I especially liked that [spoiler] the motivation of the 'big bad' was attaining world peace, a laudable goal, but it was his means that were problematic (means which reflect his personality).[/spoiler]
+The setting is fascinating, blending science fiction with a story with heart.
+Gameplay was engaging; although very conversation-focused, it was a simpler version of Phoenix Wright, using evidence to discover character lies.

Cons:
-The music...holy hell, the music was annoying.  It is extremely repetitive and loud.  I played most of the game on mute, tbh.
-Occasional translation problems, but this would probably only bother people who are really finicky.
-Elements of the story were predictable, specifically the two 'twists'.

If you like plot-heavy and conversation-based stories, then I would highly recomment this little gem.  At this price, even paying full-price for it is well-worth it imo.

Further, I really hope that there is a sequel in the works, as I found myself really growing attached to a lot of the characters.

The characters in this game are all amazing, the music is wonderful, and the way the game just captured my heart with
its style all made for an incerdibly enjoyable journey. I can't possibly recommend this game enough, it's dirt cheap and sooo
very worth it.

36218946.review: Cute game, but some parts felt disjointed. The logic sections aren't very intuitive, sometimes you have to click things at random to discover whether they are what the characters are ready to discuss, or if you have to allow them to keep talking for a few more cycles before introducing the information. They do give you the option to play with additional hints, which I opted out of, but they may be necessary. Additionally, while befriending all the characters is fun, I was at a loss with how to figure out which gifts they might like the most. Maybe for some there were clues in talking to them, but I honestly had to look up a guide, which I feel takes a little bit out of the genuine experience of talking to a character and being able to discover things about them before initiating friendship events. Those issues I would say are just a rough design, not really anything that makes it unplayable or unsatisfying. My smallest complaint is the music ... some tracks were fitting, others were really odd and ruined the tone of the dialogue with certain characters - but that's just a personal issue, some may enjoy the music. That aside, I enjoyed the plot - it runs like a visual novel with just enough interactive portions to keep the player engaged, which can be difficult to do. The characters are memorable and well-written, and the art style is adorable - coming from their previous releases, which were pixels with the occasional full art slide, it's an interesting change and one that is much appreciated.

36163169.review:
良い所
・かわいらしいキャラグラフィックや、スタイリッシュ風味な手描き背景
・コンシューマーで言う所のペルソナっぽい、歌系BGM
・本編の推理やおまけのミニゲームに至るまで全てオリジナルグラフィック
・主人公を含めた主要キャラクターがとても個性的で、人数も多い
・ヒント機能があるので、推理ゲーが苦手な人でもプレイしやすい

人による所
・キャラクターイベントを発生させるためにキャラ一人一人へのプレゼントが必要なため
　落ち物系ミニゲーム（いわゆる「ぷよぷよ」や「テトリス」）を繰り返しやらなければならない
・キャラの話を全部聞いてからでないとクリアに必要なフラグが発生しないっぽく？
　初回に途中で思いついて質問しようとすると無駄に主人公の精神力（残りライフ的なもの）を消費してしまう上に
　話が進まない
・キャラグラフィックが全体的に皆同じようにかわいらしいので、性別や年齢がわかりづらい

悪い所
・背景が大体ピンクや青・赤で、全てイラスト風なため入る場所や店がとてもわかりづらい


推理ものをプレイする時は思いついた所から推理を埋めていくフィーリング人間なせいか
順番が全てきっちり決まっているこのゲームには少々合わなかったです。
買うなら、元のフリー版をやってからの方がいいかも。
全てがイラストで統一されていて、雰囲気や音楽、キャラクターもとても良かったので
そこさえ合えば楽しめると思います。

36057735.review:
This game was incredible. I loved it so much! I think it's my new favorite game.
The characters were all amazing. I have favorites, but mostly I liked how when you befriended somebody you learn how all their stories intertwine. This guy went to school with those two, these guys are related, this person used to be friends with that dude, that chick's parents have never met, but I met them both. It was very fun to read through it all and piece it all together.
I loved the storyline in general, too. It was beautiful. I'm still trying to classify if the normal ending is actually better than the bad ending, they were both completely shocking... But the good ending made me cry. It was amazing, and hit kinda hard considering how much I feel I relate to Nanashi.
The art was so bright and happy! I loved the character designs and stuff. They were all adorable.
AND THE MUSIC. I listen to the ost on youtube all the time, it's freakin amazing. One of my favorites is the theme that plays in Cocoa Alley. During the game, when I had to go somewhere I would pass through Cocoa Alley just to hear the song. There's also one called Big Plans Remix that plays when you talk to Misane sometimes. The first time it started playing, I sat there for over 10 minutes listening to the rap and I forgot all about actually talking to her.
This game is incredible. 15/10, will definitely play again.

35528142.review:
I finished all the △○□× (Miwashiba) creations. Alicemare & LiEAT were really interesting games, especially the second one. It was a pleasure to see that Ib, or One Shot mood in it. That's my personnal favorite genre. But I wasn't really moved by them. And then, one week ago, I received 1bitheart. I heard that it was the last work of △○□× (Miwashiba), and it's a wonderful masterpiece. I never excepted to be that moved by that game. It can talk about pretty serious topics but never in a depressing way, it's really powerful. Plus, the fights of the game are conversations and, as the main protagonist, I'm really bad at it ahah ! XD There's that Phoenix Right vibe on it. Chara-design is truly wonderful, every person that you meet, even if there's a lot of them throught the chapters are just so colorful and their backround is interesting, unique for every one of them. You just can't forget them during the gameplay. There's a true effort on the music too like, since last week from today I'm just listening to the OST, they're all so catchy ! There's not a single that you cannot like in my opinion. They perfectly describe every mood, situation in the game, and help you to love every single character that you see. It's also the first time that I can hear some voice acting in a △○□× (Miwashiba) game. And what a wonderful acting :D 
XD I swear, I'm searching for bad points but there's just none of them ! 
I won't spoil the story but, as a very silent person, probably suffering of mutism in the past that also have to analyse and calculate what to say in every conversation, that hero really touched me. The fact that making the effort to talk to other people can bring you happiness & wonderful friendship in the end is not something as natural as some people can think. And, without spoiling it, the differents endings are showing this in a pretty intelligent way. You're not obligated to have people by your side but, during hard moments, it can make a great difference. 

Anyway, I finished it 100% in one week. XD What a wonderful anthem to Humanity, it's a must play for me.

35486949.review:
Se me hace difícil poder escribirle una review a este juego por la mezcla de sentimientos que me provoca, en una primera instancia de aquella vez que lo vi en youtube, me pareció un total despropósito por parte del autor teniendo en cuenta las otras obras que ha hecho, sin embargo, luego de comprarlo del bundle de Miwashiba, decidí darle otra oportunidad. Mientras que en algunos  aspectos seguí con la misma opinión de hace años, otras por el contrario cambiaron totalmente.

Positivas:
*La historia principal es divertida, siempre saltaremos de una conversación a otra donde tendremos que usar información que vamos recolectando para conseguir aun más, contradecir o argumentar sobre alguna ilegalidad.
*Como en los otros juegos del autor, posé una estética hermosa que va muy acorde con la positividad y alegría que hay en ese mundo
*Amplia variedad sonora,  si bien hay algunas que son “royalty free” la mayoría sigue siendo original del juego, y vaya que hay una gran variedad, lastimosamente mis canciones favoritas suenan 1 vez cada una, pero supongo que es cuestión de gustos.
 *Cuenta con voice acting, que aunque  no me gusta que hablen en japonés sigue siendo un plus que algunos pueden disfrutar
*Tiene un mensaje bastante fuerte y obvio, realmente se me hace difícil que alguien no pueda identificarlo al final
*Referencias a una gran cantidad de videojuegos y películas, hay una gran mayoría que no entendí, quizás porque la traducción no pudo ser exacta, o quizás porque sea relacionado con la cultura japonesa, pero bueno están. Me gustaría resaltar que hacen una referencia a fucking Sharknado 

Negativas:
*Diálogos o incluso personajes muy infantiles o comentarios muy “dulces”, entiendo que eso es parte de la atmosfera pero tanto en abundancia logra que partes sentimentales no provoquen casi ningún efecto.
*Plot holes, si bien entiendo que era necesario que haya uno, no quita el hecho que no tenga ningún sentido.
*¿Te gusta jugar al tetris? ¿No? Pues tendrás que jugarlo por 2 o 3 horas si quieres ver todo el contenido del juego. Si bien en Alice mare era divertido es porque no era obligatorio ni influía en los finales.

El capitulo extra fue lo que todo lo que quise del juego en primer lugar pero bueno, en conclusión creo que 1bitHeart una experiencia bastante divertida, que lamentablemente  pudo ser mucho más, pero lo que tenemos en suficiente para perderme en un mundo alegre, positivo  y de vez en cuando, estúpido.

35379986.review:
《1bitHeart》的故事发生在一个科技高度发达的世界，主角Nanashi是一个宅男，有一天，一个女孩突然出现在他的房间，要求他出去走走，结交朋友，Nanashi决定试一试，与此同时，城里有些奇怪的事情正在发生...

游戏的画风非常吸引人，剧情也很有意思，相比作者以前的作品，游戏中的角色数量有了很大的提升，喜欢冒险小游戏的玩家可以入手。

35040599.review:
Very fun and colorful game that changed my life. It's definately up there in my top 10, maybe even #1 by pure merit of how it emotionally helped me in so many ways.

This game is essentially danganronpa without death, with the funnyness of ace attourney, and style of TWEWY. The art in this is GORGEOUS. And the seiyuu's are pretty good. Most of the music is creative commons, but that ending theme original song is a bop. If you enjoy light feel good games with an interesting plot, futuristic game settings, RPGMaker-esque games, and any of the above mentioned games, then I'm sure you'll find something to enjoy in this game. Get your tissues ready for that ending, you'll be crying. Good tears.

Oh you can also play doctor mario and tetris knockoffs if thats your jam.

Pro's:
+Emotional story about a boy opening up to others and coming to love himself
+Fun colorful characters to get close to, all having events to get to know better
+Catchy music and beautiful artwork
+Multiple Endings connected to the amount of friends you have
+Extra epilogue for more content

Cons: 
-Most characters outside of the main group don't get much screentime or development
-Friend events feel too fast and easy
-grinding for bits without the cheat takes too long
-Plot holes tied to big spoilers, mostly time junk

34942069.review: 1bitHeart is personally one of my favourite games. The music spans various genres but are generally upbeat or laidback; some of my favourite tracks are Sweet Beach and Bus Stop. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed playing 1bitHeart. It was nice seeing how Nanashi’s growth throughout the game and the story going more in-depth with every chapter. Another thing that stood out for me was the art style as seen in the various backgrounds through different areas in the town, and the unique character designs.

34922853.review:
Held off on writing a short review for this until the sound issue was fixed, which I'm glad they did. I'll do another playthrough sometime soon.

This game is very well-written. Main story aside, you can get the most out of this game by befriending all the available characters, which the game recommends you do. The art in this game is simply beautiful, with well-drawn characters and backgrounds. The actual game isn't too difficult as you can enable hints, plus you can take your time to go through the dialogue over and over in talking time if you want to. The mini-games you can play in free time are just there if you already used the cheat to max your bits, so it's mostly an optional thing unless you don't mind playing the hell out of Tetris or Puyo Puyo to grind bits for gifts. 

Overall, I highly recommend this game if you like a good story and a well-written cast of characters, not to mention amazing artwork. You might be aware that this game was originally free, but if you played it before I suggest buying it to support Miwashiba if you enjoyed the game.

34883470.review:
A story based game with beautiful character art. Its gameplay consists of absorbing information and deducing from them. 

The investigation time (Talking Time) is not too difficult as there is no time limit and the amount of lives given for incorrect answers are massive.

Overall it is heavily depandent on its side character developments as there are over 30 of them which amounts to 10+ hours  of gameplay. Fret not as the side stories are not needed to complete the game but feels good to read if played anyways.

In my Opinion, i have really enjoyed this game and will reccomend it to people who wants to experience a short story and a few puzzles.

34847832.review:
+ Adorable art-style
+ Interesting storyline & characters
+ Danganoronpa/Ace Attorny like talk-times

- May be confusing to those not used to questioning characters


By this I mean it may be confusing for people to catch on what you need to say and when, specially when you are given a new gameplay element which can kill you.

By all means though, I cannot really find anything bad to say about the game. The art-style is simple yet beautiful and the character designs stick out in a good way. I cannot really choose my favourite so far because I like all of them and the story itself I am enjoying.

If you like events where you have to collect clues and call out lies in people's statements then get this game for sure.

34764088.review:
Miwashiba is one of my favorite illustrators and game-makers thus far. She’s the type of person to develop better the more she works.  Miwashiba did a splendid job on this one. The art is simple -but simply beautiful; giving off her unique sense of cuteness. It's really colourfull, and nice! The hairstyles, and outfits are really intersting too! Not so mention the characters whos are really cool, and well done.

The gameplay is simple, but working well: It's a 2D game, you go around talking to people and stuff. That’s the main gameplay element. It may seem boring, but the story prevents that from being too repetitive. Sometimes (at the important events) there are an action called "Talking Time", where you have to use your logic, and get the facts together. They are somewhat challenging, you need to pay attention. (if you enable tips, it will be easier, and i really recommend it, otherwise it can be frustrating.) The characters are unique, you wont get bored quickly, while trying to befriend them.

The music is really cool, and wont get boring. The unique themes for every level, and for conservations really stands out.

I played Miwasiba's previous games, and i do like them very much, but i have to claim this is her best game so far.
Subjective Rate : 10/10
I definitely recommend this gem!

34755157.review: It may not be fully voiced, but by jove am I happy that they kept the original voice acting instead of getting god awful last minute work done, or having it removed entirely. So happy in fact, that with such a low price point, voices that don't ruin emotional impact by sounding more poorly emoted than Microsoft Sam and a unique art style that doesn't look like a monkey who just learned sign language was forced to finish it under contract, I'm locked into giving it my seal of approval. Because lord knows if a game isn't about a stock asset racing down a stock asset to land in a stock asset, with trading cards that pay for the game itselfTM, it literally becomes better than over a quarter of the gold mine saturated in algae and mold that is Steam.

34703097.review:
Review from playing Chapter 1. 

With music that draws straight from the Persona games, and a conversation/interrogation system heavily inspired by Danganronpa, 1bitHeart is an aesthetically pleasing science-fiction RPG that has heart and charm. However, so far the game seems to be extremely linear. I don't doubt that the budget of the game makes it so that there is little to do other than follow the plot. 

But for what I've paid, I've gotten a lot out of it. My interest is hooked. Excited to continue playing the game.

Would definitely recommend trying this game. Don't be discouraged by the slow start.

34629389.review:
以前玩过免费版，现在来补个票（doge）
△○□×的作品里对“友谊”的态度一直让我感触颇深，不管是Alicemare、Lieat、还是1Bitheart
下面介绍一下游戏（只玩过英文版，如果有错望指正）
[h1]首先 这是一个推理游戏[/h1]
玩法类似弹丸论破+逆转裁判。在主线剧情（类似弹丸的[非日常篇]）中，你要四处调查，询问相关人物：【询问】步骤分为2部，一个是从对话中收集信息（第二章后可以追问，类似于逆转裁判中的【威慑】），另一个便是指出人物对话中矛盾。当真相大白后便可以推进剧情的发展；而在休息时间（类似弹丸的【日常篇】）中，你可以在你的电脑里打俄罗斯方块赚钱（别问为什么）[strike]（PS：主角自称超高校级游戏大佬(｀・ω・´)）[/strike]，拿赚来的钱买礼物加众人的好感度，你教的朋友越多，你的生命值便越高。最终结局与你的pong友数量挂钩，所以务必珍惜你的友谊(●—●)。
秘籍（spoiler预警）：[spoiler]游戏中在你PC登录界面的某个墙角藏有999999円[/spoiler]
[h1]剧情方面[/h1]
“我叫774，我没有名字，人们叫我废柴、辣鸡、私宅，所以随你怎么称呼我吧”
在一个所有人的设备都被统一管理时代，人们的信息来源主要依靠于与脑电波相连穿戴在耳朵上的“Bitphone”。
主人公七七四（nanase，谐音nanashi）是一个天才极客，同时拥有着通过Bitphone读取他人思想的超能力，然而因此，他从小便被排挤，所以一直独来独往，闭门不出。直到有一天，他起床的时候发现地上躺着一个从未来穿越而来的谜之少女，而那位少女，似乎在追寻着某个不寻常的任务。。
[spoiler]你以为我会剧透？不，太长了我懒得写。况且剧情引发的思考需要自己来体会，不是么？（doge）[/spoiler]

最后，我还是期待出中文版的，毕竟我不会日文，而Vgperson的英化又一股翻译腔。。～(´ー｀～) 
[strike]我永远喜欢Aira小姐姐[/strike]

PS:续作1BeatHeart已经可以在△○□×的官网上找到了(ﾉﾟ▽ﾟ)ﾉ
[url=http://1beatheart.nobody.jp/]http://1beatheart.nobody.jp/[/url]
（配色突变，从原来的的少女粉变成了Alicemare哪种灰灰的配色，就像从逆转裁判穿越到大逆转裁判一样，不过我喜欢）

34587613.review: Fantastic game. Endearing characters matched with a great light-hearted writing style, brilliant art direction and an eclectic soundtrack. Don't think any less of it because of the price point, this is a must buy if you like VNs or games such as Danganronpa, Persona and The World Ends With You.

34584266.review:
I played this game just a couple months ago. Now that it's on steam, I purchased it immediately! Miwashiba makes a great game about making friends and adventure!

If you like games where you get to meet an interesting cast of characters, listen to cute music from the web, and playing tetris for money, this is the game for you! Takes place in a cute futuristic set of towns, each with their own flavor and style.

I think it's 5/5 and shouldn't take too much of your time (unless you spend a huge amount of time on the Tetris part haha). It's a straightforward and really cute game and well worth your time.

Like I said, bought on steam to support the dev, so only 5 minutes played so I could review it, but this game took me about 22 hours. probably something like 15 hours of Tetris and 5 hours of the main story. There is a secret way to get free money in the game if you don't want to play Tetris though haha. Look it up.

I really enjoy playing this game. You walk around a town to get clues and you solve a different mystery each chapter that i believe leads to one big one. Its not too easy or too hard if you are following along with whats happening. The art is very pleasing to look at especially the character designs. The music is nice as well pretty catchy and soothing to listen to while playing.

34555943.review: Nice little cute game make some friends as you save the world 10/10 would reccomend

34554508.review:
An anime game where the characters have clothes on, WHUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUUT?

And a game that has a transgender character who is actually a character and not just a pawn for getting the game bonus points for inclusion.

Also an RPG Maker game which isn't just the boring archaic RPG Maker engine with some custom assets added in.


While the initial plot start off seems really unrealistic, once it's on its way it feels very natural and immersive. The dialogue is well written and interesting, the humor is smart and includes sexuality without being perverted or overbearing. The basic gameplay is simple and focuses on the story, however it is mildly innovative enough to make it still feel stimulating.

Exactly what RPG Maker games should be, using the engine as a framework but still making a unique game out of it.


Totally worth the price, great value for how much actual effort and quality is in this.

34552791.review: a must have if you already played the other games of Miwashiba!

39382201.review:
I've been told about and recommended Miwashiba games a few times in the past, and contemplated watching a Let's Play in the past of one of them and never gotten around to do it. Recently seeing 1bitHeart during the holiday stream sale, I decided "why not?" and finally got it. And I do not regret it one bit.

First of all, the art is beautiful and stylized nicely. The cutesy and bright colors paired very well with this game. Not to mention all the characters, even minor ones who you only ever talk too during their friend events, were designed well and uniquely. However, I do feel that some heavily rely on tropes (Like Misato or Saaya). Regardless of this, they were all still enjoyable at the same time! Misato's was especially one of my top favorites. 

The game has some slapstick humor to it, the mc gets punched/hit/kicked/whatever by the main assistant to a fairly frequent degree. I personally didn't find it too overbearing, but if slapstick isn't your cup of tea I would keep it in mind.

One final thing is the soundtrack. Bless this soundtrack. I got to mid-way of chapter 2 when I toyed with the idea of buying the dlc soundtrack, by chapter 4 I had already gone and purchased it. Each area has it's own music that matches the tone of both the area and the game in general wonderfully. During friend events the soundtracks do get reused between several characters, but there's enough of them and broken far enough apart that you're not listening to the same ones constantly. 

All in all? 1bitHeart was a fantastic trip with just the Happy end, I look forward to getting the Bad and Normal endings and have already bundle purchased LiEat and Alicemare, (Other Miwashiba games) and look forward to playing them in the future.

38976317.review:
[h1]ナナシ君の「純粋さ」と不思議な少女が薦める「友達作り」の意図、この辺がストーリーの鍵を握ります。[/h1]
マルチエンディング形式ですが、このゲームの核心とも言うべき「なぜ不思議な少女が”友達作り“をナナシ君に薦めたのか」を知るために、是非全エンディングを見るべき、と思います。（HappyEndが最も難易度が低いと思うのですが、これだけでは不十分で、全エンディングを見て、初めてストーリーの奥深さを知れると思います。）

[h1]ゲーム本編について[/h1]
ストーリー展開の上手さ、BGMのカッコ良さ、いいです。実にいいです。推理パートも、良くある類似商用ゲームにある「理不尽な選択肢」がないので、案外すんなりとストーリーだけに没頭できます。（というとこの手の推理ゲーム嗜好者には物足りなさがあるのでは、と思われるかも知れませんが、決して難易度が低いという訳ではありません。やり応えはあります。）

惜しむらくは、[spoiler]登場人物の多くが「友達になったところで終わり」な点です。そこからゲーム内SNSで推理に役立つような情報のやり取りができたらなお良かったのですが。[/spoiler]
あとゲーム中のミニゲームですが [spoiler]公式公認のチートが存在していて、ミニゲームが必須というわけでもありません。しかもこれが「秘密の実績」項目の１つだったりするのですが、これを「秘密」にしなくとも良かったんじゃないかなと。[/spoiler]
多少の粗削りな面はありますが、それでも十分遊ぶ価値はありますね。レビューの高評価から見ても言うに及ばずですが。

[h1]おまけ[/h1]
作者の △○□×（みわしいば）さんが作成されている [url=http://1beatheart.nobody.jp/]スピンオフ作品「1BeatHeart」[/url] や [url=https://www.amazon.co.jp/o/ASIN/404106368X/pixiv-comic-22]小説版[/url] などがあるようです。すでにハマってクリアした方もぜひ。

38949136.review: 话说，画风是超级喜欢这种画风的，虽然英语还行，也算勉强看得懂剧情，但是考虑到天朝玩家平均英语水准，没有汉化这个差评还是得给。

38944137.review: Cute sprites in a cute world with a cute concept. I feel fluffy inside after this game.

38925424.review: Miwashiba's games are extremely creepy at times. Almost in the borderlands next to intolerable. There are multiple moments in this game that made me genuinely uncomfortable. Not sure if that's just because I'm not really used to these kinds of games or what. I loved LiEat. But I found this game more thought provoking than "fun". And there's nothing really wrong with that. They broach topics in this game that are completely out there in day to day life. Things that many individuals think about but never voice really. It takes place in what appears to be a futuristic dystopian Japan and your a late teen that goes around speaking to people. Where the creepy part comes in is how some of the characters speak. LiEat never really made me super uncomfortable. Some of the concept art was questionable yes... All in all a psychological trip and it may just be the weirdest game I have ever played. I do look forward to his future work, though I hope it is less batshit crazy.

39435103.review:
The game is very reminiscent of Persona, back when I found it very interesting, good music, creating social bonds, and a community-wide problem that affects the mindset of different people

Gameplay 8/10 - While it doesn't really demand a lot of concentration from the player, it quickly becomes very interesting and thought provoking without sacrificing ease to progress.

Graphics 10/10 - It's really good. While this rating may be a bit biased as I've known Miwasiba for a long time since when he was my favorite vocaloid Illustrator, I believe that other reviews can reinforce this statement by stating the fact that the art style is very cute. And let's be honest, it was the very reason why I first picked up this game. (And every other game by Miwasiba).

Story ?/10 - I haven't finished the game yet, though the story thus far has proven to be very interesting

Music 9/10 - It may be just because Miwasiba has worked with vocaloid producers before (people like REOL and Mafumafu) but the music chosen in his games was very engaging, and fit the mood of each of the backgrounds and the situations pretty well

Overall 9/10 - While it's not a really immersive game, I think that this game is a very interesting and, like I said before, really reminds me of Persona, particularly Persona 3 wherein so many different new concepts were introduced to us JRPG  players. So, if you really enjoyed Persona 3, this game will most likely interest you.
